business.headline: Smriti Irani discusses gender parity with World Bank leaders, highlights India's progressDuring her meeting in Washington, Smriti Irani highlighted the need for effective implementation of gender equity policies to ensure that women, especially in developing regions, can contribute to both government and industry while realising their full potential.

Sensex, Nifty rise ahead of US Fed rate decision; Ola Electric shares surgeThe S&P BSE Sensex was up 90.88 points at 83,079.66 at the closing bell, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 34.80 points to settle at 25,418.55.

Zerodha to bring 'Alert Trigger Orders' on Kite mobile: What you need to knowUnlike standard alerts that only notify traders when certain market conditions are met, ATOs take it a step further by automatically executing a basket of orders.

Bajaj Housing Finance shares rally 160% post-IPO: Book profits or hold?Bajaj Housing Finance share price: On Tuesday, the stock hit its 10% upper circuit at Rs 181.50 on the National Stock Exchange (NSE), continuing its upward trajectory.
Will US Fed cut rates by 25 bps or 50 bps? Here's all you need to knowA 25 bps rate cut could calm markets, but a deeper one may raise economic alarm.

US Fed likely to cut key rates this week. Why is it a big deal?The US central bank is likely to cut interest rates for the first time in more than four years, with experts predicting a 0.25 percentage point reduction.
Ola Electric set for 50% upside? Here's why Goldman Sachs is bullishGoldman Sachs has projected a 50% upside for the Ola Electric stock, setting a target price of Rs 160.

Bajaj Housing Finance shares continue post-IPO rally. More upside left?Bajaj Housing Finance share price: The sharp rise in the company's share price comes a day after the company's stellar IPO debut and indicates continued bullish momentum in the stock.
Explained: Why Ola Electric shares jumped over 6% todayOla Electric shares rebound sharply after a month-long slump. Read on to know what fuelled today's surge.

PN Gadgil Jewellers makes bumper debut: Book profit now or stay invested?PN Gadgil Jewellers share price: Market experts see the sharp premium at listing as a signal of investor confidence in PN Gadgil's strong growth trajectory.

PN Gadgil Jewellers shares make bumper debut with 73% premium over IPO pricePN Gadgil Jewellers listing: The Maharashtra-based jewellery retail chain saw a strong listing on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE), where its shares opened at Rs 834, marking a 73.75% premium.
Sensex, Nifty open flat near all-time highs ahead of US Fed's rate decisionThe S&P BSE Sensex was down 23.7 points at 82,965.08, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 3.25% to 25,380.50.
Inheritance war: How fight for PRS Oberoi's legacy is unfolding in courtThe dispute revolves around late PRS Oberoi's estate, with conflicting wills and claims on shares, properties, and assets.

Amazon, Flipkart violated competition laws by favouring certain sellers: ReportThe investigation was triggered by a complaint from the Delhi Vyapar Mahasangh, which is an affiliate of the country's biggest trade body, Confederation of All India Traders (CAIT), that represents 80 million retailers.

US Fed poised to cut rates: Can it steer economy toward soft landing?After months of elevated interest rates, the Fed is likely to lower its benchmark rate, potentially giving a much-needed break to the economy.

Sensex, Nifty close slightly higher; Bajaj Housing Finance shines on debutThe S&P BSE Sensex ended the trading session 97.84 points higher at 82,988.78, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 27.25 points to settle at 25,383.75.

Sebi withdraws statement blaming external elements for staff protestsJust under two weeks ago, Sebi had issued a statement suggesting that external forces were behind the unrest among its staff, which was seen as an attempt to discredit the organisation and its leadership.

Missed Bajaj Housing Finance listing day rally? Check these alternate optionsBajaj Housing Finance bumper listing: By the end of the trading session, the company's stock price stood at Rs 164.99, marking a significant increase over its IPO issue price. But for those who missed out on the listing day windfall, what are the next steps?

Oberoi inheritance war: Siblings clash over late PRS Oberoi's willOn one side are Vikramjit Oberoi, Natasha Oberoi, and Arjun Oberoi. On the other side is Anastasia Oberoi, PRS Oberoi's daughter from his second marriage to Mirjana Jojic Oberoi.

Bajaj Housing Finance shares hit upper circuit after bumper listing: What's next?Bajaj Housing Finance listing: By midday, the shares hit an upper circuit at Rs 164.99, representing an overall premium of 135.70% over the IPO price.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Arvind Kejriwal quits as Chief Minister, Atishi stakes claim to form government Live UpdatesAtishi's name was proposed by Kejriwal at the meeting of the legislature party, and it was unanimously accepted by the AAP MLAs.

India win 5th Asian Champions Trophy hockey title after beating resolute ChinaJugarj Singh's 51st minute goal proved to be the difference as India defeated China 1-0 in the final to win their 5th Asian Champions Trophy on September 17, Tuesday.

PM Modi a listening leader: Piyush Goyal on NDA 3.0's 'U-turns' in first 100 daysSpeaking exclusively to India Today TV on the first 100 days of the NDA government's third term, Union Minister Piyush Goyal said rejected the Opposition's charge of the NDA government making 'U-turns' in its first 100 days.

Manoj Verma appointed new Kolkata Police chief day after Vineet Goyal was removedManoj Kumar Verma has replaced Vineet Goyal as the new Kolkata Police Commissioner after West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee announced the removal of Goyal, a key demand of the doctors protesting against the trainee doctor's rape and murder.

Aam Aadmi Party now in a new packAAP convenor Arvind Kejriwal stepped down as the chief minister of Delhi and named Atishi as his successor. The move, months ahead of the Assembly polls, is to repackage the AAP by getting a taint-free person as its face even as the hands pulling the strings remain the same.
Supreme Court pauses unauthorised bulldozer action till October 1The court stated that its directives are not applicable to any unauthorised construction on public roads, footpaths, among others.

Florida boy, 11, arrested after mass shooting threat, bragging about 'kill list'An 11-year-old boy from Florida, Carlo 'Kingston' Dorelli, was arrested after allegedly making violent threats and showing classmates a video of his weapons collection. The boy faced felony charges for making a written threat of a mass shooting.

Italian PM Giorgia Meloni wishes PM Modi on his 74th birthdayItalian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni extended her birthday wishes to Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi, expressing optimism for the future of bilateral relations.

100 days of Modi 3.0 vs Modi 2.0: Why C is for contrastAs Modi 3.0 marks its first 100 days with a blend of bold moves and strategic retreats, the contrast with the sweeping reforms of Modi 2.0 is clearly visible. Short of a majority, the BJP's shift from big-bang actions to a more cautious approach shows that in the dance of democracy, compromise is as crucial as ambition.

Swati Maliwal attacks Atishi, says her family fought to stop Afzal Guru's hangingRajya Sabha MP Swati Maliwal, who's had a bitter falling out with the Aam Aadmi Party, criticised the decision to appoint Atishi as Delhi's Chief Minister. Maliwal said that her parents had fought to prevent terrorist Afzal Guru's execution.

Swifties raise $40,000 for Kamala Harris using Trump's anti-Taylor Swift postSwifties for Kamala, an organisation of Taylor Swift fans, has raised over $40,000 for Kamala Harris's campaign after Donald Trump criticised Swift on Truth Social, saying, "I HATE TAYLOR SWIFT!" The fan group capitalised on Trump's post to boost donations.

26 years apart, how Atishi has Sushma Swaraj parallelsAs Atishi is set to take over as the chief minister of Delhi, there are uncanny parallels with BJP leader Sushma Swaraj, who became the first woman CM of Delhi 26 years ago. Both took over just months ahead of Assembly polls due to crises in their parties. Swaraj, like Atishi, had managed several portfolios, including education.

Kangana Ranaut says Jaya Bachchan is 'most dignified' days after calling her 'arrogant'Actor and politician Kangana Ranaut took a moment to appreciate Jaya Bachchan in an interview recently. She praised the veteran actor for the way she carries herself in Parliament, and also for her film choices.

Congress ecosystem rattled: PM on attending Ganpati puja at Chief Justice homePrime Minister Narendra Modi defended his recent participation in a Ganesh Puja hosted by Chief Justice of India DY Chandrachud in New Delhi.

India to rest Jasprit Bumrah in 2nd Test? Rohit Sharma drops major hintIndia captain Rohit Sharma has said that the team will rotate its fast bowlers in this long Test season. Sharma said that India will follow the process followed in the England Test series earlier where they gave breaks to Jasprit Bumrah and Mohammed Siraj.

Delhi only has one chief minister. It's Arvind Kejriwal: Atishi in first remarksIn her first remarks after being chosen as the next Delhi Chief Minister, Atishi assailed the BJP for filing 'false cases' against Kejriwal trying to destabilise the government.

Paedophilia, stalking, abuse: What kidfluencers pay to make money onlineSocial media is helping kidfluencers - kid influencers - make a lot of money, but the real cost of fame lies in the trolling and abuse on social media.

Secret Service agent saw gun barrel, opened fire: Trump on assassination bidFormer US President Donald Trump recounted the attempted assassination at his golf course in West Palm Beach, Florida in a social media interaction. He described hearing gunshots and being rushed to safety by the Secret Service.

How Kejriwal outfoxed BJP, each time, every timeArvind Kejriwal outfoxed the BJP by announcing he would resign as Delhi's Chief Minister. With this, he has blunted the BJP's poll arrows, including the opportunity for him to be attacked as a 'CM out on bail'. Here's how Kejriwal has been shocking the BJP time and again.

Watch: IAS officer Tina Dabi's reaction as woman sarpanch delivers speech in fluent EnglishTina Dabi, who was appointed as the District Collector of Barmer earlier this month, applauded Sonu Kanwar for her speech as seen in a video that has gone viral on social media.

Masaba Gupta didn't have money to pay cook during Covid: Made masks to cut lossesActor-designer Masaba Gupta recently opened up about her financial struggles during the coronavirus-induced lockdown. She said she didn't even have money to pay to her cook.

Atishi: Oxford-educated AAP leader set to become Delhi Chief MinisterKnown as a fierce Arvind Kejriwal loyalist, minister Atishi Marlena Singh led AAP's charge at a time it was battling multiple crises.

New Covid variant XEC is spreading fast in Europe: Know all about itThe new XEC variant of coronavirus was identified in Germany and is spreading rapidly in Europe. It is a hybrid of two omicron subvariants.
Partial lunar eclipse tonight: It will be visible in these citiesThe event coincides with a "supermoon," making the Moon appear larger and brighter.

Watch: SEVENTEEN unveils intriguing 1st teaser for upcoming album Spill The FeelsK-pop group SEVENTEEN released a captivating teaser for their upcoming album Spill The Feels, showcasing all 13 members against Thailand's scenic backdrop. The video was unveiled on September 17.

Archana Puran Singh says she earns less than others on The Great Indian Kapil ShowActor Archana Puran Singh talks about her remuneration on Netflix's comedy show, The Great Indian Kapil Show. She says she earns less than the other cast members on the show.

Director James Gunn shares Govinda's 'Superman' video: When Marvel met DCWho knew Guardians of the Galaxy director James Gunn followed Bollywood? The director recently shared a funny video of actor Govinda, where he was seen dancing to a song dressed as Superman.

Hansal Mehta on re-releasing his films: Don't have that moneyHansal Mehta, in an exclusive interview with India Today Digital, spoke about plans to re-release his films. He also opened up about box office numbers and shared that The Buckingham Murders has almost recovered its investments.

sports.headline: Asian Champions Trophy: Pakistan trolled for supporting China in final vs IndiaThe Pakistan hockey team were trolled for supporting China in the final of the Asian Champions Trophy. The hosts China squared off against India in the final and lost 0-1.

Improved Mehidy Hasan ready to take over Shakib's place: HathurusinghaBangladesh head coach Chandika Hathurusingha lauded Medhidy Hasan as the most improved player in the side. The coach said that the spin-bowling all-rounder is ready to take over Shakib Al Hasan's place when the legend retires.

Jason Gillespie backs Australia to end India's winning streak in upcoming BGTFormer Australia fast bowler Jason Gillespie has backed Australia to beat India in the upcoming Border Gavaskar Trophy 2024-25.

Rohit Sharma calls Jaiswal, Jurel and Sarfaraz's hunger for runs 'good sign'Rohit Sharma heaped praise on Yashasvi Jaiswal, Dhruv Jurel and Sarfaraz Khan for their hunger for runs and success. The new-gen stars will take part in a 2-match series between India and Bangladesh.

PR Sreejesh, Harmanpreet Singh nominated for FIH Hockey Stars AwardsIndia captain Harmanpreet Singh and legendary goalkeeper PR Sreejesh are among the nominees for the FIH Hockey Stars Awards, the The International Hockey Federation announced on September 17, Tuesday.

ICC announces equal prize money for Women's T20 World Cup as men's editionThe International Cricket Council (ICC) have announced equal prize money for the upcoming women's T20 World Cup 2024 as the men's tournament held earlier this year.

Gambhir's coaching staff has different style compared to Dravid: Rohit SharmaIndia captain Rohit Sharma said head coach Gautam Gambhir's style is different from his predecessor Rahul Dravid but insisted that he has a good understanding with the new appointee.

Rohit Sharma's cheeky response to reporter: 'Bangladesh series isn't important?'Rohit Sharma gave a cheeky response to a reporter and said that every series is of the utmost importance to the Indian team. Rohit will lead India in a 2-match Test series against Bangladesh.

Rohit Sharma quotes England's example to warn Bangladesh ahead of Test seriesIndia vs Bangladesh: Captain Rohit Sharma said that every team in the world wants to beat India and enjoys doing that, but he and his players don't look at that aspect and just go about doing their job.

Asian Champions Trophy Final Highlights: India beat China 1-0 to clinch titleAsian Champions Trophy hockey Final Highlights: India win their 5th title after beating China 1-0 in the final at Hulunbuir. China defended well for the first three quarters, but it was Jugraj who found the net, helping India to yet another title in the competition.

Rohit Sharma vows to bring the best out of KL Rahul in upcoming Test season India captain Rohit Sharma has backed KL Rahul to come good in the upcoming Test series against Bangladesh. India and Bangladesh will lock horns in two-match Test series beginning from September 19.

Bangladesh Tests 'dress rehersal' for Border Gavaskar trophy? Rohit Sharma reactsIndia will not be using the Bangladesh Test series as a 'dress rehersal' for the Border Gavaskar Trophy 2024-25, according to captain Rohit Sharma. The India skipper claimed the team will be focused on winning the Chennai Test against Bangladesh first.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

WC influential ten: Writers community honors digital social change makersWriters Community Freelancers Releases 'WC Influential Ten' List Recognizing Social Impact through Virtual Space and Social Media
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
